Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.name: Yuzu
Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.description:
Yuzu is an open-source emulator that allows you to play Nintendo Switch games on platforms such as Windows, Android and Linux.
Yuzu allows you to experience all of your Nintendo Switch titles on different devices at the same level of performance your console provides.
Yuzu provides an easy-to-use interface where you can get up and running with emulating your favorite Switch games in no time.
Start playing your Switch games like you never experienced before. Play your favorite titles in 4K, transfer your games, and play with your friends in multiplayer. Built with portability in mind, you don’t have to worry about compatibility with popular devices.

Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.name: Ryujinx
Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.description: Ryujinx APK is an advanced Nintendo Switch emulator that allows users to seamlessly play Switch games on Android devices as well as Windows, macOS, and Linux systems. The app focuses on delivering smooth gameplay with high compatibility and customizable settings. Ryujinx has an intuitive interface, allowing users to easily adjust graphics, controls, and sounds for a personalized gaming experience. Highly rated by users for its frequent updates and stable performance, Ryujinx APK stands out as one of the best emulator apps for Nintendo Switch fans. Unlock your favorite Switch games anytime, anywhere with Ryujinx APK.

Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.name: Egg NS
Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.description: Egg NS Emulator is a software that allows you to run Nintendo Switch games on your mobile phone. Players can run Egg NS on their mobile phones to play Nintendo Switch games, and it brings a different control experience to Switch fans. The Egg NS emulator was developed by NXTeam Studios in the United States over a period of two years, and is now available. NXTeam will continue its efforts to optimize the performance, stability and compatibility of the Egg NS emulator. Our heart still lies within the Egg NS emulator and we are always active in developing New and Innovative Products that we ourselves use in our everyday gaming lives. Get Starded! Your support has enabled us to be the best that we can be.

Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.name: Skyline
Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.description:
Skyline is an open-source Nintendo Switch emulator for Android that you can use to emulate the Nintendo console on your smartphone. Its name comes from the Nintendo Switch software code name "Horizon", for which "Skyline" is a synonym.

Among the formats that the emulator is capable of reading are NSP, XCI, NRO, NSO and NCA. If you don't know the file format of the game you want to play, they are sorted by "all" in the main tab, so that you can see all those on your device. If a game still doesn't appear, then in the settings, you can choose which folder you store the games in, and that is where the emulator will read them from.

Advertisement

Remove ads and more with Turbo
After telling the app where your game can be found and entering the production keys, you'll be able to run it. Some games may perform better than others, and others may present some problems when emulated. The game controls appear on the screen.

The Skyline emulator has many options: for example, you can force the "dock" mode so that the game performs at maximum power, as it would if you had the Nintendo Switch in the dock. You can also edit the graphics to improve its performance.

So if you want to emulate your Nintendo Switch games on Android, downloading the Skyline APK is an excellent way to do this.

Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.name: Shudachi
Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.description:
Welcome to Sudachi Emulator, the cutting-edge solution for experiencing Nintendo Switch games on multiple devices.

Developed with high performance and user experience in mind, Sudachi enables fans to run their favorite Nintendo titles with enhanced graphics, smooth gameplay, and customizable settings for an unparalleled experience.

Super Smash Bros Screenshot
What Sets Sudachi Apart?
Sudachi Emulator isn’t just about running games—it’s about bringing them to life.

By focusing on high compatibility and optimized performance, Sudachi ensures that you can play a wide range of Nintendo Switch games, from big titles to indie gems, with exceptional detail.

Our advanced architecture also means better load times, improved graphics rendering, and lower hardware requirements, making the experience accessible and enjoyable for everyone.

Yuzu Compatibility List
Key Features of Sudachi Emulator
- Enhanced Graphics: Enjoy visuals that push beyond the limits of the Switch console with upscaling, custom resolutions, and shader support.
- Easy Game Configuration: Customizable settings allow you to fine-tune game controls, resolution, and other elements to fit your device perfectly.
- Performance Optimization: Sudachi is built to perform smoothly on a variety of devices, reducing lag and maximizing your gameplay quality.
- Community and Support: Join a vibrant community of fans, access detailed guides, and get real-time support for a seamless experience.
Getting started with Sudachi Emulator is simple. Download, configure your game settings, and dive into your favorite Nintendo titles on a new level.

Ready to explore? Check out our guide and start playing today!

Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.name: Citron
Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.description: Citron is a Nintendo Switch emulator for Android and Windows, focused on delivering a high-performance and user-friendly experience for playing homebrew games and exploring new titles. It's designed with both enthusiasts and developers in mind, and it's important to note that Citron is intended for legal homebrew use only and is not affiliated with Nintendo. Citron aims to provide a stable and efficient platform for running homebrew applications, offering features like high compatibility, customizable controls, and regular updates to enhance the gaming experience. The emulator is open-source, allowing the community to contribute to its development and improvement.

Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.name: Eden
Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.description: Eden is an experimental open-source emulator for the Nintendo Switch, built with performance and stability in mind. It is written in C++ with cross-platform support for Windows, Linux and Android.

Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.name: Kenji-NX
Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.description:
Kenji-NX is an open-source Nintendo Switch emulator, originally created by gdkchan, written in C#. This emulator aims at providing excellent accuracy and performance, a user-friendly interface and consistent builds. It was written from scratch and development on the project began in September 2017. Kenji-NX is available on GitHub under the MIT license.
On October 1st 2024, Ryujinx was discontinued as the creator was forced to abandon the project.
This fork is not a Ryujinx revival project; it aims to be a middle ground between GreemDev's Ryujinx fork and the more preservative ryujinx-mirror fork. It brings over many of the front-facing features from the aforementioned forks with additional contributions from KeatonTheBot and others.

Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.name: Nyushu
Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.description:
The Nyushu Emulator is a Nintendo Switch ROM console emulator, offering enhanced performance and optimization.
Nyushu Emulator is an upgraded version of the popular Yuzu emulator, designed specifically for Android devices with lower GPU capabilities. It offers smoother gameplay and enhanced performance, making it a top choice for mobile gamers.

Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.name: Pine
Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.description:
Pine is an experimental, open-source emulator designed to run Nintendo Switch games on ARMv8 Android™ devices.
It is licensed under the GNU General Public License v3.0 or later.
The emulator is a clone of Skyline, another Nintendo Switch emulator, and shares similar features and interface.
To use Pine, you need to download and install the APK file on your Android device and then set up folders for GPU drivers, product keys, and games within the app.
Performance can vary depending on your phone's hardware, with a recommended setup being an Android 10+ device with at least a Snapdragon 865 processor and 6GB of RAM for optimal experience.

Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.name: MeloNX
Nintendo Switch Virtual Console.description:
"MeloNX" (or "MelonX") is a Nintendo Switch emulator designed specifically for iOS devices, allowing users to play Switch games on their iPhones or iPads.
Here's some key information about MeloNX:
Availability: MeloNX is not available on the official App Store due to its use of JIT (Just-In-Time) compilation. Users need to sideload the emulator using third-party tools like AltStore or developer certificates.
Performance: The emulator aims to provide smooth performance, with some users reporting good frame rates for certain games like "Mario 3D World" and "Donkey Kong Tropical Freeze" on high-end iPhones.
Features: MeloNX offers a dedicated video-out mode, allowing users to connect their iPhone to an external display and enjoy games on a larger screen, according to Reddit. It also supports controller input for the game menu in this mode.
Memory Entitlement: To achieve optimal performance, MeloNX requires an extended memory entitlement which can be installed via sideloading methods like AltStore or SideStore.

Windows Emulators.name: Winlator
Windows Emulators.description:
Winlator is an Android application that enables you to run Windows (x86_64) applications and games on your Android device.
Key features:
- Compatibility: Winlator leverages Wine and Box86/Box64 to create a compatibility layer for Windows x86 and x64 software.
- Gaming Focus: While it can run various applications, Winlator is primarily known for its ability to emulate PC games on Android, including both 2D and some 3D titles.
- Offline Functionality: Once games are downloaded and installed within Winlator, you can play them without an internet connection.
- User-friendly Interface: Winlator aims to be easy to use for both beginners and experienced users.
- Customization: It offers various customizable settings to optimize performance, resolution, and more.
- Control Options: Winlator includes built-in touch controls and supports external gamepads, keyboards, and mice.
- Driver Support: It provides different graphics driver options like Turnip (for Snapdragon Adreno GPUs), VirGL (Universal, suitable for other GPUs), and LLVMpipe (software renderer, slower).
- Game Management: You can create containers within Winlator to manage different games and applications, and even create shortcuts for easy access.
- Performance Optimization: Winlator allows you to tweak settings like Box86/Box64 presets, resolution, and other parameters to enhance in-game performance and stability, especially for Unity games.

Windows Emulators.name: GameHub
Windows Emulators.description:
Game Management Platform: A unified library for organizing and launching games from various platforms like Steam, GOG, Humble Bundle, and Humble Trove, supporting both native Linux games and those running on Wine/Proton, DOSBox, RetroArch, and ScummVM.
Mobile App with Mini-games: An Android application offering a collection of casual and brain-training minigames, including puzzle games, arcade games, and board games like 2048, Sudoku, Chess, UNO, and more. It emphasizes convenience by combining many games in one app.
Gaming Hub (Samsung): A built-in feature on Samsung devices that automatically gathers and organizes your mobile games, allows for game optimization, and offers "Instant Plays" — a selection of games that can be launched without installation.
Cross-platform Gaming Platform: A versatile platform (like the one developed by GameSir) that allows playing PC games on Android devices through high-precision compatibility and supports PC emulators, cloud gaming, and game streaming. It allows for both controller and touch controls.
Gaming Community Hub: An online platform or community connecting gamers, enthusiasts, and developers to share insights, discover new games, and engage in discussions about gaming technology and culture.
In essence, GameHub acts as a centralized location for various gaming activities, whether it's managing game libraries, enjoying a collection of mini-games, launching games on a mobile device, or connecting with a gaming community.

Windows Emulators.name: Horizan Emulator
Windows Emulators.description:
Horizon Emu (or Horizon Emulator) is an application for Android that allows users to run Windows x86_64 applications, including some games, on their devices. It's important to note that a fake, paid version of Horizon Emu exists on the Google Play Store, so users should be cautious and download the official version from its GitHub page to avoid potential viruses.
Here's a summary of its features and important information:
Functionality: It acts as a Windows emulator for Android, allowing the execution of Windows applications, primarily targeting games.
Open Source: Horizon Emu is an open-source project.
System Requirements:
Minimum Android Version: Android 9 or above.
CPU: Any CPU with AArch64 architecture.
GPU: Any GPU with Turnip support (meaning Adreno GPUs are generally supported, while Mali GPUs may not be).
Root: Root access is not required.

Windows Emulators.name: Micewine Emulator
Windows Emulators.description:
MiceWine is a project that aims to run Windows applications and games on Android smartphones. It is similar to other Windows emulators for Android, like Winlator and Horizon Emulator.
Here's how MiceWine works:
It uses a customized build of Wine compiled for Android.
It also uses Box64, a user-space emulator that allows running x86-64 Linux programs (like Windows applications compiled with Wine) on ARM64 Linux systems (like Android devices).
In essence, MiceWine creates a compatibility layer that translates Windows API calls into native Android API calls on-the-fly, allowing Windows applications to run on Android devices without requiring a full Windows installation. This eliminates the performance and memory penalties associated with traditional emulation or virtualization methods.
However, it's important to note that MiceWine is still in active development, and compatibility with certain applications or games may vary. Some users have reported issues like black screens or graphical glitches

PlayStation 3 Emulators.name: aPS3e
PlayStation 3 Emulators.description: Native PS3 Emulation: Designed to run directly on Android devices for better performance. Growing Game Compatibility: Supports a growing number of PS3 titles, including popular ones like GTA V, Demon's Souls, and God of War, though not all games are guaranteed to work smoothly. Touch & Controller Support: Features on-screen controls and partial support for Bluetooth controllers for a more console-like experience. No Ads (Free Version): The basic version is free and ad-free, with a premium version available for those who want to support the development team.

PlayStation 3 Emulators.name: RPCS3
PlayStation 3 Emulators.description:
Official Port: An official Android port of RPCS3 is currently under development.
Early Stages: While it shows promise, with some demanding games like God of War 3 running on it, the Android port is still in its early stages and may have limited compatibility and performance compared to the PC version.
Minimum Requirements: Requires Android 12 or above and a high-end device with a Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 processor or above, and at least 12 GB of RAM for playable performance.
Development Progress: The official port is being actively developed, and performance and compatibility are expected to improve with updates.

PlayStation 4 Emulators.name: shadPS4
PlayStation 4 Emulators.description:
Emulator/Compatibility Layer: shadPS4 allows you to run PlayStation 4 games on a different platform (like your PC) by translating the PS4's instructions and resources into something your computer can understand.
Free and Open-Source: The software is available for free, and its source code is accessible for anyone to inspect, modify, and improve.
Platform Support: It is designed to work on Windows, Linux, and macOS operating systems.
Current Status: shadPS4 is currently in early development and can only emulate some games to varying degrees of support.

PlayStation 2 Emulators.name: DamonPS2
PlayStation 2 Emulators.description:
DamonPS2 is available in both free and Pro versions. The Pro version offers additional features like HD rendering, gamepad support, and the ability to save game progress using memory cards.
Criticisms: Users have reported issues with stability, compatibility, and performance, even on high-end devices. Concerns have also been raised about the app's licensing and its alleged use of the open-source PCSX2 code without proper attribution.
In short, DamonPS2 allows you to play a wide range of PS2 games on your Android device, but it's essential to be aware of the potential performance and compatibility issues.

PlayStation 2 Emulators.name: PPSS22
PlayStation 2 Emulators.description:
PPSS22 Emulator is a PS2 (PlayStation 2) emulator available for Android devices.
Here's a summary of its features and other relevant information:
Platform: Android.
Purpose: Emulates PlayStation 2 games on Android devices.
Key Features:
Good compatibility with PS2 games.
Supports external game controllers.
Allows easy saving and loading of game states.
Aims for fast game speeds, similar to the original console.
Offers network gaming capabilities.
Supports compressed game ROMs in zipped/7z/rar formats.
Runs PS2 games efficiently on ARM devices with X64 architecture.

PlayStation 2 Emulators.name: Play!
PlayStation 2 Emulators.description:
PCSX2 from their official website. Nightly builds often include the newest features and fixes. You may need a tool like 7-Zip to extract the downloaded files.
Acquire PS2 BIOS files: For legal reasons, PCSX2 doesn't come with the necessary PS2 BIOS files. You'll need to obtain these files yourself, either by extracting them from your own PS2 console or by finding them online (though downloading them may have legal implications depending on your region and the specific laws).
Get PS2 game ROMs (ISO files): You'll also need the game files in ISO format to play them with the emulator. Legally, this generally involves creating backups of games you physically own.
Configure PCSX2:
During the initial setup wizard, select your preferred language.
Point PCSX2 to your PS2 BIOS files.
Adjust graphics settings based on your PC's hardware. You can try different rendering options like Vulkan, OpenGL, or Direct3D for better performance or compatibility with your graphics card.
Consider setting the internal resolution to match your monitor's resolution or even higher for improved visuals.
Enable widescreen patches (if available) for a modern aspect ratio.
Configure controls using your keyboard or a game controller.
Explore other settings for further optimization, such as audio synchronization and latency.

PlayStation Vita Emulators.name: Vita3K
PlayStation Vita Emulators.description: Vita3K is the world's first functional experimental open-source PlayStation Vita emulator available for Windows, Linux, macOS, and Android. It allows users to play a variety of PlayStation Vita games and homebrew applications on their computer or Android device. Here are some key features and aspects of Vita3K: Cross-platform compatibility (Windows, macOS, Linux, Android), open-source development on GitHub, support for commercial and homebrew games, virtual and physical controller input, and ongoing experimental development. Note: Not all games run perfectly—some may have graphical glitches or performance issues, emulation requires significant hardware resources, and savestates are not currently supported (use in-game saves).

Nintendo 3DS Emulators.name: Citra
Nintendo 3DS Emulators.description: Citra is an open-source emulator for the Nintendo 3DS, allowing users to play 3DS games on various platforms, including Windows, macOS, Linux, and Android. It supports both 32-bit and 64-bit systems and offers features like high-resolution rendering, controller support, and online multiplayer. Citra is known for its active development community and compatibility with a wide range of 3DS titles.
